body.p: I send you (in “Author’s Copy”, paper Trans. Vol.XIColenso W 1878. Contributions towards a better knowledge of the Maori Race”, Trans NZ Inst. 11, 77-106. Here Colenso and Harding appear to be planning a pamphlet republishing that paper; Hector did accept further papers in the series (in 1879, 80, 81).) the notes I had thought of for Appendix D.—as they are, they are much too long (I fear) and I see no ready & easy way of shortening them—unless we omit all their notes (This mg. too, I feel wholly unfitted for the task! Can scarcely sit to write this, yet no bodily pain) see pp 101–103.

This paper (art. V) contains the bit quot. from Ruskin—we were talking of last night. This paper (I may say to you) was a favourite one of mine, if you have not yet read it do so. I have always much regretted that Dr. H. & Co., so acted towards me as to be the means of my not going on with that series. I hope to find something suitable for T. p. motto, &c.
please tell your Compo. to keep copy please.
